page.title: 09A FOREST RANGER'S DAY
page.content: It is still dusk at 4am, & after a cup of tea & filling my flask with coffee, I collect the food that was made up last night & make my way to the forest. Deer contol is my calling. Two year old roe deer bucks do the most fraying on young trees. After two hours & having seen one buck, I go off to another area of forest to visit grey squirrel hoppers & traps. Wheat treated with an anticoagulant liquid is fed in these hoppers to control the grey squirrels, which do much damage by stripping off bark. I have some food at about 9.30 am and then go on to further hoppers & move some to other sites, inspect some fences, shoot 3 rabbits, & get home for 2pm.I eat & rest, fill up the forest ranger's diary & feed the ferret and my dog in the evening.
